intro: Trientalis, commonly known as starflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers, which typically bloom in early spring. The plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including North America, Europe, and Asia. Trientalis species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. They have small, alternate leaves and produce capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
